clinical_study.brief_title: Oculomotor Markers and Attachment in Adolescents
clinical_study.official_title: Oculomotor and Neurophysiological Markers of Emotion Regulation and Attachment Styles in Adolescence

brief_summary.textblock: The study aims to identify specific visual scanning patterns of attachment pictures in adolescent with different attachment style.

detailed_description.textblock:
Oculomotor parameters will be assessed during visualization of 2 sets of pictures. The first set presents a distress picture and is followed by a slide composed of 3 pictures (one representing comfort, one representing complicity and the last representing a neutral scene).
Psychophysiological parameters (skin conductance reactivity-SCR) is also assess during this visualization.

primary_outcome.measure: number of entry in distress pictures
primary_outcome.description: these parameters will be compared between the different types of attachment.

primary_outcome.description: these parameters will be compared between the different types of attachment.

secondary_outcome.measure: interaction with the parent: score to the GPACS (goal-corrected partnership in adolescence coding system)
secondary_outcome.description: the quality of the interaction with the parent and the confusion of the parent-child role will be compared between the different attachment types.

intervention.description: visual scanning behavior is assessed during visualization of emotional pictures
ASI is used to determine the attachment style of each participant
this consists of the measurement of the skin conductance reactivity (SCR) during the picture visualization
self administered questionnaires are used to assess anxiety, depression and alexithymia.
an interview of the adolescent parent is performed in order to assess the confusion of the parent-child role and the interaction between the child and its parent.
